page.title: 19MODERN SEQUENCE DANCE CLUB.
page.content: We meet at Grendon Working Men's Club on Tuesday evenings at 7.30.We pay 30p each week;there are 90 members,aged between fifty and seventy,from all walks of life. The first half hour is tuition time when Colin and Carol walk us through a new dance,which perhaps takes three weeks to learn.The fun starts when he puts the record on and we are not very sure of the steps! From 8.00-10.30 we dance those we have learned over the past 5 years,such as Happy Feet Quickstep,Honeysuckle Saunter,Rumba Victoria,Iris Foxtrot, Beverley Ann Waltz,Sally Ann Cha Cha, Cindy Swing etc. Lots of members are widows,so some ladies 'take' as a man,NEVER two men together.Most ladies drink 'Slimline' orange while the men enjoy a pint of beer.Colin holds a Saturday evening Dance once a month to which we all look forward.
